alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 10 at 9:56PM PST until January 12 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM WEDNESDAY TO 7 PM PST THURSDAY ALONG THE BASE OF THE OREGON BLUE MOUNTAINS... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility less than one mile in dense fog. For the High Wind Warning along the base of the Blue Mountains, southeast winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts 55 to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the High Wind Warning, from 7 PM Wednesday to 7 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Dense Fog Advisory, some areas will see temperatures around or below freezing which could result in some slick conditions through the morning due to the fog.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon
